page.title: 05Dr Shroff
page.content: Dr Shroff lives in Halling. He has about 3500 patients, 2000 of whom live in Cuxton. His surgery in Cuxton is a modern building, opened in 1972. He sees about 250 patients a week, mostly with coughs, colds and sore throats. Because Cuxton is in a rural area most people are quite healthy but hay fever is an increasing problem. Fortunately drug taking and glue sniffing do not appear to be problems. The birth rate is steady, about 50 babies being born in a year. The average life span is between 65 and 70 years, heart attacks causing most deaths. Stress conditions caused largely by unemployment are becoming more common. Medicines are dispensed at the surgery because there is no chemist's shop in the village.
